Package teller

Interface TellerMachine

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LimitedTellerMachine
    public interface TellerMachine
    This interface represents the operations of a teller machine. A teller machine contains notes/coins of specific denominations. It supports adding and withdrawing notes and coins of the denominations it supports.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void deposit​(int... deposit)
      Add notes/coins of the specified denomination to this teller.
      int getQuantity​(int denomination)
      Return the number of notes/coins in this teller of the specified denomination.
      boolean withdraw​(int... request)
      Withdraw the requested change from this teller.

    • Method Detail

      • deposit

        void deposit​(int... deposit)
      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Add notes/coins of the specified denomination to this teller.
        Parameters:
        deposit - several pairs of (denomination, quantity) to be deposited. Denominations are in no specific order. For example, if 10 1s and 20 2s are to be deposited, then this method is called as obj.deposit(1, 10, 2, 20) or obj.deposit(new int[]{1, 10, 2, 20}). A call to this method with no parameters does nothing.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there are an odd number of numbers specified, any denomination given is not supported by this teller, or any quantity is negative.

      • withdraw

        boolean withdraw​(int... request)
        Withdraw the requested change from this teller. The request can be fulfilled so long as the total amount requested is at least the total amount in this teller. The request cannot be fulfilled if an unsupported denomination is part of the request or a negative quantity is requested. An empty request has no effect. If the requested quantity of a particular denomination is not available, then the teller automatically makes change by using bigger denominations available in the teller.
        Parameters:
        request - several pairs of numbers (denomination, quantity) that represent the requested amount of change. Denominations are in no specific order.
        Returns:
        true if the request can be fulfilled, false otherwise.

      • getQuantity

        int getQuantity​(int denomination)
        Return the number of notes/coins in this teller of the specified denomination.
        Parameters:
        denomination - the denomination whose quantity is requested.
        Returns:
        the quantity of the specified denomination in this teller. If the denomination is not supported by this teller, this method returns 0.
